bullets.text: Supreme Court review of Trump tariff authority could curb unilateral trade powers, injecting uncertainty into U.S.-China tariff regime and global supply chains.
Shutdown forces SNAP to pay only 50% benefits in November, squeezing low-income consumption and pushing demand onto charities and local governments.
Starbucks sells 60% of China unit to Boyu Capital, ceding control to navigate slowing growth and regulatory risk in its largest market.
Kimberly-Clark to acquire Tylenol owner Kenvue for $48.7B, creating consumer-staples giant and betting litigation risks won’t derail cash-generation.
Amazon inks $38B, multiyear OpenAI-AWS cloud deal, underscoring AI compute scarcity and reinforcing Amazon’s position among hyperscaler winners.
Microsoft accelerates AI capacity with Lambda deal, $9.7B IREN pact, and $15.2B UAE investment, blending industrial buildout with geopolitics over AI alignment.
Palantir tops estimates and lifts Q4 outlook on AI demand, but shares wobble as valuation and growth durability face scrutiny.
Fed Governor Lisa Cook remains undecided on December rate cut, signaling data-dependence and keeping rates path uncertain into year-end.
Rare earths and critical minerals stocks surge as countries race to secure supply chains, highlighting strategic materials’ leverage in clean-tech and defense.
U.S. EV sales slump at Ford, Hyundai after federal credits lapse, even as Stellantis commits $13B U.S. investment, underscoring policy-driven demand and industrial buildout.
Beijing’s long-running self-reliance drive, via five-year plans, deepens economic decoupling from West, reshaping trade, tech access, and capital flows.
Bitcoin breaks key support; Ether drops 7% after DeFi protocol hack, spotlighting crypto’s technical fragility amid macro crosscurrents.
First validated blood test for Chronic Fatigue Syndrome promises objective diagnosis, enabling targeted trials and potential reimbursement shifts.
New brain connectivity map for Parkinson’s could personalize deep brain stimulation and accelerate therapy development.
Broken sleep-wake cycles implicated in Alzheimer’s progression, suggesting chronotherapy and sleep interventions as potential disease-modifying strategies.
